dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piercing high note is sustained on the soundtrack as th main title, "CRYSTAL JAPAN" speeds straight at the audien in 3-D and seems to jump right out at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The opening credits follow.  Ominous theme music fills th soundtrack, growing darker and more dissonant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The theme music slowly dissolves into the sound of a radi news broadcast, as the credits continue to unfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and I'm Ed Harris with the KLTZ Early Morning Report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theme music out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Crystal Lake in Pinehurst County, the scene of several unsolved deaths years ago, is tragically back in the top of the news this morning.  Police have uncovered the remains of eight, as yet, unidentified persons in a gruesome and baffling story of mass murder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End credits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting over a line of ruffled bushes with leaves just turning towards a rural, time-worn country market.  A wid gravel parking area makes it accessible to the highway running past it, otherwise, this Mom & Pop store seems al like a vision of times gone by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bushes and overgrown grass, unrestrained by any human care, strengthen the sense of isolation.  The dying sun shoots its last rays through the trees behind the market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The market has a battered second-story: the living quarte of the people running it.  A truck roars by.  Then silenc and then again the sound of the radio news report:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Judging from the sheer brutality of the murders, police theorize that they must have been committed by at least four persons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sagging clotheslines cluttered with drying laundry run ac a narrow backyard, all the way to a rickety old shed.  Th clotheslines are supported by one solitary pole.  Linen a garments billow in the rising evening breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold, foreboding music accompanies the camera as it moves toward a pair of flapping khaki pants and an olive green workshirt hanging side by side on the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The radio news report grows louder as the clothing snaps directly into the lens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The sole survivor of the massacre has been taken under heavy sedation to County Hospital in Linfield for observation. She's been unable to provide police with any clues and is being kept under round the clock guard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then a man parts two shrouds of wet laundry, making h way back towards the house.  This is HAROLD: 40ish, paunc unshaven and so clumsy that he hits the clothesline pole knocks it down, burying himself under a heap of linen.  A transistor radio pops out of the pocket of his threadbare shirt, still broadcasting the news.  One of the upstairs windows opens with a creak, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold's wife, sticks her head out and looks into the backyard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud, harsh) Goddamnit Harold!  I spent all day yesterday washing your clothes and look what you're doing to 'em. Shows how much you care about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold watches her from under the pile of laundry.  Then grabs the radio, staggers up, increasing the radio's volu as he does so, to drown out the voice of his wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Above him, Edna raves on for a moment (we can't make out she is saying), then furiously slams the window shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is musty and cluttered like an old attic.  Edna stomps away from the window and turns her attention to th partially functional, old clunker of a black and white TV She plops herself down onto the lumpy couch and picks up knitting needles and returns to work on a sweater.  A new report about the mass murders is being broadcast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A police spokesman tells Eyewitness News that authorities have been combing the area since just before dawn.  Reports of cannibalism and sexual mutilation are still unconfirmed... Nevertheless, these murders are already being called the most brutal in local history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leans in to adjust the long rabbit-ear antenna, spreading ears apart for a better picture.  She listens intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motive behind the grisly murders remains a mystery at this hour as does the identity of the killer or killers.  The search continues for more bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) My God, My God, My God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Residents of the Lake region are being urged to take extra precaution when approaching strangers and to report anything unusual to police, immediately. We'll be back with the weather forecast after this important message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visibly upset, Edna rises to her feet.  She goes over to door leading downstairs to the market, opens it and call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold, what're you doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.  She rushes to the window, jerks it open and sticks her head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Harold... I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of the backyard.  The laundry quietly swells in the wind. For an instant, a human form is visible between layers of drying clothes.  From this distance, Edna can't make out it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unnerved by the continuing noise of the TV, Edna goes bac shut it off.  She quickly returns to the window and looks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sign of anyone, but there is an empty span of clothesl where several articles of clothes were hung, only a secon before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna runs for the apartment door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna flies down the stairs and enters the store from the back.  The market is dark, save does shafts of dying sunl through the grimy front windows. She scans the few aisles back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big rabbit appears from behind an arrangement of Campbe soup cans, and stands on its hind legs on the aisle, tryi to guess Edna's next move.  Still calling Harold, she tur starts at the sight of the rabbit; she grabs a tomato fro the produce display, throw it at the animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) God Damn pest, what are you staring at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She misses, grabs more vegetables and hurls them at the rabbit.  The rabbit dodges them, and scurries away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sunlight is almost gone, stretching the shadows even more.  In her nightgown, Edna pushed open the creaky scre door and steps out into the backyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooting towards her through the laundry flapping on the clothesline.  As she touches a set of pajamas and finds o that they are still wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shoulder suddenly enters the flame, and someone's silhouette blocks the screen just for a couple of seconds before the intruder slips behind another curtain of dryin clothes, revealing Edna again:  she's still checking the clothes and hasn't noticed anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes to where the trousers and workshirt were, and n longer.  That's a shock, but she's not quite sure that th were here in the first place, so she goes on, and starts talking to herself to fortify her ailing courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ All Mighty, Harold, you just take what's yours and leave the rest for me to do.  Very considerate! (collecting the dry laundry and putting it in a basket) You could at least finished the job.  Do I have to do everything around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna hears a noise and whips around.  Her imagination is working overtime. A bedsheet is swelling slowly in the breeze, taking the s of a human body.  Is anyone behind it?  Ominous music...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swallowing hard) Harold... I swear, sometimes you're such a child...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She charges forward.  She rips the sheet off the line and falls in a heap with it.  There is no one behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns over and lays on her back.  Above her, there's the dark evening sky and the branches of a tree, rustling back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna gets up and quickly pulls the remaining laundry off lines, tossing it into the basket.  As she does, she pass near the wooden shed at the back of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shed door creak open.  Edna turns around.  Suddenly, there's a crashing noise from inside.  That's enough for Edna... she hauls up the basket and rushes back inside th store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white rabbit that gave Edna such a scare is now hoppi across a row of canned goods.  A man's hand enters frame grabs the rabbit by the nape of its neck and lifts it off shelf, into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Harold.  He places the rabbit on his shoulder and gr a jar of peanuts from the shelf.  He twists open the vacu sealed jar and wolfs down a handful of its contents.  Wit another handful, he feeds the rabbit, who sniffs and part

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold rescrews the lid and places it back on the shelf. turns on the radio in his breast pocket.  Music blares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his broom and starts sweeping down the aisle, th rabbit remaining contentedly on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold stops at the dairy case and grabs a half-gallon ju milk.  He breaks the seal and pulls off the cap.  He firs offers the rabbit a taste, then gulps down a swig himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unidentified face, in soft focus, peers in through the storefront window then disappears almost as quickly.  Har is unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: screws the cap back on and replaces the jug in the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of crunching and munching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold turns around.  The the produce section, the cellop packages of carrots on display are moving slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches in and pushes off the top few packages to reve underneath, another rabbit, a grey one this time, nibblin a carrot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lifts the rabbit out of the case and places it on his opposite shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking from one rabbit to the other) Sorry guys, it's back to the slammer before Edna make a fur coat out of ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his way to the back door, Harold passes a rack of cake and pies.  He stops long enough to open a box of six chocolate-covered donuts.  He takes one out and shoves it into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbeknownst to Harold, a human form in shadow appears at back door.  The door is quietly pushed open.  Someone is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera as stalker enters the store and moves slowly towards Harold, his back to us.  Ominous music accompanie the approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checks filled to capacity.  Harold closes the package and puts it back in place on the rack, hiding it under severa unopened packages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold turns.  The stalker is right behind him, completel startled, he jumps back and chokes on the doughnuts.  The rabbits hop off his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unexpectedly, Harold find himself face to face... with hi wife, Edna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I feed you enough for breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The doctor said you had to lose weight, didn't he?  I try to help you but you sneak food behind my back.  What am I gonna do with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, Harold bends down to retrieve the rabbits He scoops them up in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And put those filthy animals back where they belong, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold exits by way of the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold puts the grey rabbit on his shoulder, the white ra remains wrapped in his arms.  He swallows the rest of the doughnut in his mouth as he flips a flashlight out of his back pocket and ambles across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light filters through the cracked walls partially illuminating a variety of tools, old barrels, various odd ends - and a rabbit hutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold flicks on the flashlight as he enters.  The rabbit atop his shoulder jumps off and scurries away.  The rabbi his arms squirms and squeals.  The animals sense that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stroking the white rabbit) What're you little guys so nervous about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scans the shed with the flashlight to locate the runaw as he tries to contain the jittery ball of fur in his arm The flashlight searches each corner, until the beam final stops on:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music pounds hard on the soundtrack, as through the hutch grillwork we can see a mass of dead rabbits, lying one ne to the other, staring up with glinting, glass eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold stands immobilized, in a state of shock.  He looks down upon the limp bodies of his beloved pets, his face turned into a sad mask of outrage.  He holds onto the whi rabbit even tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would do this...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trembling, Harold reaches to lift the lid of the hutch. music throbs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big timber rattlesnake springs out of the hutch, mouth and open, twin poisonous fangs shining in the beam of the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music drops out as the snake's loud kiss dominates. muscles of its dark, lean body push the deadly mouth ahea into the lens of the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instinctively, Harold slams the hutch down, dropping his flashlight and the white rabbit.  The snake hisses and sp at the camera through the wife mesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Literally scared shitless, Harold races out of the shed, holding his stomach with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold dashes through the back door, and up the stairs li a charging bull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold bursts through the door, crashing into his unsuspecting wife.  Edna is knocked off balance and tries hold onto him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?  What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold can't talk.  He rubs his stomach and heads straigh for the bathroom, vanishing inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's all the crap you've been stuffing yourself with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna turns up the volume on the TV and plunks herself dow the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for her knitting bag and empties its contents One of her two, long, thin knitting needles is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rummaging all around her) Now where could that other needle have gone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is a combination:  storing place mostly, there a two ample cupboards facing each other, each leaning again a wall, a mess of crates and boxes lying on top of each o behind a dusty curtain... and a toilet bowl, left from th days when this was just an oversized bathroom.  The toile bowl is against the fourth wall, at an angle behind the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the TV filters through the door as Harold, trousers down to his knees, sits on the toilet, sighing w relief as the first bout of diarrhea is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loosens his collar, wipes some sweat from his brow, reaches behind the toilet tank, and produces a hidden bot of Whiskey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unscrews the cap and takes a hardy swig.  He leans bac and shut his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Those poor little creatures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another swig.  Some of the liquor spills over his chin an wipes it with his sleeve.  His eyes wander around aimless then focus on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: partially masking the mess of boxes and crates.  It seems ripple subtly, moved by an ever so slight movement of air perhaps someone's breath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold waits.  The curtains seem still.  Harold is about relax when a brief, hollow noise is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold tries to locate the noise, but it's over before he tell its source.  Pants around his ankles, he rises, shuf to one of the closets.  It takes some courage to yank the door open, and the camera moves fast into a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAT CLOSEUP of empty shelves - nothing has touched them a long time, except dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathing relief, Harold pulls up his pants again, just enough to be able to hobble grotesquely to the dusty curt He rips it apart, stares at the odd assortment of boxes a crates - empty, lifeless, and uncannily menacing because their lifelessness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reassured, Harold gives the other closet a glance, almost decides against checking it - and then changes his mind, stumbles, pants still around his ankles, towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like this one hasn't been opened at all for a long time.  Harold tugs at the door - a creak, followed instan by a musical stinger as a huge hand holding a meat cleave rips into the shot, strikes Harold, imbedding the cleaver his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold manages a half-scream that mixes incongruously wit the laughter from the TV in the living room.  As the hand twists the cleaver, the scream becomes a raspy cough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold stumbles backwards and crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna hears the crash.  She turns off the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  She gets up from the couch and goes to the bathroom door.  She listens and hears the noise of the to flushing and flushing, as if someone's hand never release the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattling the door knob) Harold... what's taking you so long in there?  You all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes against the door.  It doesn't budge.  She look down and notices some kind of liquid seeping out from underneath the bathroom door.  She dips her fingers in it sniffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Whiskey, I thought so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes over to a desk, opens a small drawer and finds a skeleton key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries back to the bathroom/storeroom door, ready to insert the key.  To her shock, the door is now open a cra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Edna is nonplussed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Harold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the door - it swings open, revealing the open closets, the boxes and crates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna steps inside and inadvertently kicks the half-empty bottle of Whiskey.  She picks up the bottle while the flushing noise persists maddeningly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns toward the toilet, which is behind the door and screams at the sight of Harold sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pants down, like a grotesque dummy, blood drooling out of corners of his mouth, the meat cleaver sticking out of hi chest and one elbow stuck against the flushing handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Whiskey bottle falls from Edna's hand, hits the floor shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edna screams uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind her a huge hand enters the flame and pierces back of her head with the previously missing knitting nee The needle is pushed out through her mouth, right at the camera. she gags on her own blood and slums out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group ethnic children are playing stickball in the stre weatherworn two and three-family houses on either side of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red passenger van screeches around the corner and heads down the block, slowing down as it advances on the oblivi children.  The driver sounds the horn, warning of the van approach.  Most of the children scatter, but a few don't, yelling and banging on the sides of the van as it passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van continues for a few yards then parallel parks in first available space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver Chris...19, blond, attractive but intense...st down and circles around to the passenger side where two others jump out.  They are Debbie...19, brown-haired, vivacious and healthy, the all-american cheerleader type...and Andy...slims, athletic and ruggedly handsome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) It's the last house on the left. She lives downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris turns back to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling through window) Hey Shelly!  Come on out and meet your date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from inside van) Bring her to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks back at Andy and Debbie for advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging his shoulder) What're you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe this wasn't such a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris calls into the van once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you two?  You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two other voices shout back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison) No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris throws up her hands in frustration, joining Andy an Debbie.  They cross the street abreast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS in front of the three friends.  A rotund, ominous-looking figure in a hideous, ghostly white mask springs out from around the hidden side of the van.  The figure follows a safe distance behind the unsuspecting threesome, brandishing a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk, Andy and Debbie are locked in each other's and they begin to kiss.  Chris looks at them and shakes h head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex, sex, sex.  You guys are getting boring, you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie breaks the kiss, feeling a little embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what would a weekend in the country be without sex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stern) Cool it, Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (apologetic) I didn't mean it the way it sounded...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little by little, the masked figure advances from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andy and Debbie) Look guys, I don't want to ruin your weekend.  What happened to me at the cottage happened a long time ago and I think I've worked that out. I'm all right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure draws even closer raising the knife above his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I appreciate the fact that you worry about me, but don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we won't.  We'll just have fun, all agreed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The masked figure rears back and plunges the knife into Andy's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rubber knife bends in half.  Andy, Debbie and Chris w around to face the assailant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Dammit Shelly!  Why do you always have to be such an asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still wearing the mask) I beg your pardon, I'm not an asshole.  I'm an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Debbie, in disgust, turn away and walk off.  An drops back to walk with Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (paternal) Look Shelly, you're my roommate and I like you... most of the time.  But you gotta stop doing these things.  Now, I set this date up for you, didn't I?  So don't embarrass me.  When you meet this woman, just relax and be yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you be yourself... (ripping off mask) ...if you looked this this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly puts on a pair of unflattering prescription glasse Although he has a pleasant face, Shelly is overweight, gr haired and unkempt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Debbie lead the way for Andy and Shelly up the porch steps, to the front door of a shabby, two-family ho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris rings the bell.  Shelly takes a few steps back.  He mats down his unruly hair, tucks in his shirt and takes o his glasses.  He's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens and a middle-aged Hispanic woman stands be the outer screen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Spanish accent) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) Hi, Mrs. Sanchez.  I'm Chris. We've come to pick up Vera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bruskly) She's not going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shuts the door in Chris' face.  The group stands ther not knowing what to do next.  V.O.'s from inside the hous they can hear Vera and her mother arguing in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I flunked Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to leave when suddenly the front door swing open.  This time Vera, knapsack over her shoulder, ready go, comes out onto the porch.  She's a knockout...20, exo raven-haired beauty...in tight jeans.  They turn and star her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (forcing a smile) Hi everybody, what're you looking at.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly, intimidated by Vera's sexy good looks, steps behi Andy and slips the mask back over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vera) Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, just your basic old fashioned mother problems. (changing the subject) So, where's my date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly comes out from behind Andy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sheepishly) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (letting her disappointment show) You're Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy angrily rips the mask off Shelly's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking across the street) Hey!  The van's on fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White smoke billows out of the van windows, engulfing the vehicle and the luggage tied to the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole group rushes off the porch and races to the van The first one there, Andy, opens the passenger side door jumps in.  Chris runs around to the driver's side and doe the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through thick, acrid smoke, Chili and her boyfriend, Chuc Cheech and Chong lookalies...can be seen sitting in the b on the floor, each puffing away like crazy on a bong fill with Marijuana.  Each wears a stereo headset that is plug into their own Sony Walkman portable cassette players.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Chris looks at each other as if to say "I should have known."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' red van speeds along the empty rural highway throu the lush New England countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the driver's side window, the wind blows in on Ch and tosses her flaxen hair as she drives.  Debbie sits on Andy's lap in the passenger seat - the only other seat in van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much farther to the cottage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could've been there already... (looking at Debbie) ...if some people didn't have to go to the bathroom every five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) Oh yeah...well just hope that you never get pregnant, 'cause all you do all the time is piss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili and Chuck are sprawled out on the floor, taking inventory of their numerous joints and bags of Marijuana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly sits cross-legged near the very back of the van, opposite Vera, who sits with her legs open.  Daydreaming, gazes upward at the sky and treetops through the back win

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly can't stop staring at Vera, admiring her sexy body Vera senses that Shelly is undressing her with his eyes a quickly turns her head around and catches him looking at breasts.  Shelly averts his eyes in embarrassment and loo over at Chuck who lights up a joint, inhales and hands it Chili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all you two are gonna do this weekend...smoke dope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not, man?  Is there a law against it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (persisting) There's better things to do with your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inhaling) I can't think of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers the joint to Shelly.  He declines.  Chili offe it to Vera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, why not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera comes forward on her hands and knees, reaching out f the joint.  As she does, she inadvertently thrusts her shapely rear end almost into Shelly's face.  Shelly makes attempt to retreat from it.  Actually he rather enjoys it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she draws on the joint) Is this stuff any good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home grown, man!  Of course it's good!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's good for you, too. Strictly organic.  No preservatives, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy sniffs at the air around him filled with the aroma o good grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, let's share the wealth with those less fortunate up front here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera passes the joint to him and sits back down across fr Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly is rummaging through a small black suitcase. It's contents are concealed from Vera's view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curious) What d'ya got in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very secretive) My whole world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that little thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick around and you'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera turns away and looks out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear the faint sounds of sirens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, two police cruisers, with lights flashin in hot pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others) Better hide that grass.  It's the cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out her sideview mirror) Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out the back window) What are we gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroy the evidence, Pronto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroy the evidence?  No, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking right at Chuck) Yes, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at one another, perplexed.  Vera is amused. Without a word and simultaneously, Chili and Chuck begin stuff loose grass and joints into their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) Come on, dig in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing a bag) Aw shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to eat.  Vera joins in, too.  The police sirens grow louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruisers advance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy grabs another bag and hands it to Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try me some other time.  I'm driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy turns to Debbie and offers up the cellophane bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.  We're pregnant.  Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sirens seem to be getting closer.  Chili leans in beh Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better step on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van speeds up, but so do the police cruisers, even narrowing the gap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili, Chuck, Andy and Vera's cheeks are filled to capaci with dope.  Their faces are turning green.  Still they continue to stuff in more at a frantic pace. Shelly holds his black suitcase tightly to his chest as h watches out the back window with concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster!  Eat faster!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing Shelly a fistful of grass) Why don't you help us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) Uh... I guess I'm just not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full) You're always hungry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To appease everybody, Shelly begins to nibble ever so slightly on the marijuana out of Vera's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're too close.  I gotta pull the van over.  Hurry up and swallow!  Everybody just be cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pulls the van to the side of the road.  She sticks head out to watch for the approaching cruisers.  Much to surprise and everyone else's, both police cars zoom by th van without stopping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A collective sigh of relief, followed by groans of regret what they've just done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (belching) I think I'm gonna be sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding her stomach) The line forms at the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna be sicker than all of you, man.  Now I gotta spend the whole weekend totally straight... (buries his head in his hands) I don't think I can make it, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck... look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slowly unbuttons her blouse.  Everyone looks at her, puzzled.  Chuck raises his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mistaking Chili's intentions) Not now, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her fingers reach inside her bra -- but instead of freein her breasts, she pulls out a good size plastic bag of marijuana.  Chuck's mouth drops open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a slow eater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing his arms around Chili) I love you, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He attacks her with kisses.  The others laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two police cruisers make a sharp right into the small 'n Pop store parking lot and SCREECH to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group of curious onlookers congregate at the fron entrance of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruiser lights continue to flash red and blue as the Police Officers step out of their vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officers order the onlookers to "go home" then enter store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris' red van approaches down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris slows down the vehicle as she sees the flashing pol lights and ambulances.  She rubber-necks to see what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A team of Medics carry out two heavy body bags from the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches with morbid fascination, fueling her anxiet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie is also looking out the window at this unpleasant scene.  She turns to see Chris and reads the concern on h face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, kiddo... don't let your imagination run away with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris turns her attention back to the highway and drives

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT on a PAIR of Scraggly Men's boots as they walk along the edge of the highway.  CAMERA TILTS UP to reveal ABEL... 72, long stringy white hair and whiskered, skinny baggy clothes, weathered stern face.  Like a lone star, h ambles down the lonely highway, dragging a duffle bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of a vehicle approaching in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel sticks out his right thumb in a hitchhiking stance. affects a smile and looks toward the vehicle down the roa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun pours in through the windshield.  Debbie shades h eyes to get a better look at the figure up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you look at that!  I've never seen a senior citizen hitchhiker before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others in the back come forward to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's give the poor old guy a break.  Pick 'im up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly reacts very emotionally to the suggestion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That scarecrow?  Can't you tell how weird his is just by looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Shelly.  Who else is gonna give him a lift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not us!  He's really creepy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is now upon the aged hitchhiker.  He flashes a sm at them:  plaintive, shy, and yet somehow ominous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reassuring) He looks just like my grandfather, man.  Let's give him a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van screeches to a halt and backs up to Abel.  The si door slides open and Abel is lifted into the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel settles into the back next to Shelly who studies the traveller with both curiosity and trepidation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris adjusts her rearview mirror to include Abel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel nods "hello" to one and all.  They nod back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in an eloquent soothing voice) You are, all of you, very kind and generous young people to lend a helping hand to a tired, old man. Thank you very much.  Perhaps I can repay the kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The civilized speaking-manner of the shabby-looking stran calms the layer of fear that any might have had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) My name is Abel.  And I am my brother's keeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going?  How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, is there any place in particular where we can drop you off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop me off?  How do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly's suspicions return and he glances from Vera to De and Andy.  Andy shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel reaches into his dusty dufflebag and pulls out a ver small bundle wrapped in a scrap of cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris watches via the rearview mirror.  Her expression is wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abel unwraps the object and places it in front of Shelly' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Look what His Grace has brought me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly looks down at a the small, slimy, white oblong thi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wincing) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found this today.  There were other pieces of the body lying there, but I believe "he" wanted me to have this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) That's an eyeball!  Oh, God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He" wanted me to warn you. (evangelical) Look at this, all of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds the eyeball out for each to view.  They shrink b away from him, cringing at the sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eyeball is reflected in the rearview mirror.  Chris i becoming quite upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) See with your own eyes what I have seen.  Runaway!  Go back to where you came from... Now!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van comes to an abrupt stop.  The side door opens and old man is practically tossed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ground, Abel yells after the van as it speeds away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I warned you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van is parked on the shoulder of the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris leans against a tree, her arms crossed over her che She looks towards the woods, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of her face, two sneakered feet pass by.  It's A walking on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera stretches her arms over her head then drops her tors and arms to the ground, bent over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people stretch their legs.... (looking at Andy) Some their arms.... (looking at Shelly eating a candy bar) And some nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of the woods, Debbie appears.  She zips up the f of her jeans and approaches the others.  Chris and Vera applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, Chris puts her arms around Debbie's shoulder and two walk toward the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From seemingly out of nowhere, the ROAR of MOTORCYCLES is suddenly upon them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group whisks around to find three souped-up motorcycl bearing down on them, navigated by a manacing-looking TRI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorcycles head straight for them.  In a panic, the group scatters.  Dust swirls as the Motorcyclists veer aw from the group and the van just in time to avert a collis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dust settles, the group picks themselves off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (brushing herself off) How come there's never a cop around when you really need one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is still driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others have assumed their respective positions.  Howe the jovial atmosphere has degenerated due to the unsettli series of incidents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long faces and silence prevails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, up ahead just off the road, a pleasant surprise, fo them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up, everybody.  Revenge is ours. (pointing out the front window) Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris slows down the van.  The group quickly moves forwar and peers out the front windshield.  One by one, a smile crosses each dour face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Three Motorcyclists have been pulled over by a State Trooper and are being ticketed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van erupts into laughter and cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the van passes the powerless Cyclists, the side door swings open and the passenger window rolls down.  The gro sticks their heads out and jeers and applauds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris turns on the radio -- Rock 'n Roll MUSIC blares as lighthearted atmosphere returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jauntily, the van zips down the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT on a half-eaten dead rabbit lying to one side the dirt road.  CAMERA DEEP-RACK-FOCUSES to the red van coming up over the hilly highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van turns off onto the dirt road and makes its way through a wooded landscape along a winding trail.  Sun dapples through the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overgrown driveway meanders among oak trees towards a rustic two-story house.  The oak trees have been there lo before the house was built -- their heavy branches hang l like tired arms, almost blocking the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house has an elevated porch and curtained windows.  I in relatively decent condition though weatherbeaten and creates from the start an impression of family history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is ample parking space before the house. On the lef side of the driveway as one approaches, some thirty yards diagonally across from the house, there is a tall red bar with a hayloft equipped with a block and tackle (to bring the bales of hay into the loft's square window). To the right of the house is an outhouse with a heartshap venthole in its wooden door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the left of the house is a large lake with a knotty ol dock and a small tree-covered island in the middle.  The whole area is surrounded by a lush landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of a VEHICLE approaching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA reveals this serene, idyllic panorama and PICK Chris' van as it bumps along the dirt road and slows down a crawl to pass over a creaky, dilapidated wooden bridge runs over a dried-up stream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA peers OVER-THE-SHOULDER of an UNIDENTIFIABLE FIGURE as he moves from one living room window to the oth watching the van as it sweeps under the low branches towa the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van comes to a stop.  Chris jumps out and looks towar the house.  A collection of memories posses her for a mom before she reaches for the knotted rope and unties the ta covering the bulk of the baggage on top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud so the others can hear) Let's bring in the luggage first, then I'll give you a tour of the house and the barn and then we can hang out at the lake... All right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.  Just the distant SOUND of FEET RUNNING and LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks around to the other side of the van and finds doors left wide open and no one about.  She turns to see friends running towards the lake, unable to resist the splendor of the shimmering water and sun dappled landscap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie turns back and gestures for Chris to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) You go ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, behind Chris, the Shadowy Figure, OUT FOCUS, appears behind a curtain in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Debbie) I'm gonna take my bags into the house first and look around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris turns toward the house.  The Figure disappears from view.  Chris grabs a piece of baggage in each hand and innocently strides up the path and porch steps to the fro door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been a while since she has last visited the family country home and she is actually pleased to have this mom to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rifles through her handbag, comes up with the keys an reaches for the doorknob to find that the door is already open, ever so slightly.  A look of concern flashes across Chris' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the distant SOUNDS of her friends by the lake can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cautiously, Chris pushes the door.  Creaking, it opens wi She hesitates a moment then takes a step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hearing a noise) Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of nowhere, a hand grabs Chris by the neck and p her OUT OF FRAME.  She SCREAMS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then the SOUNDTRACK becomes coldly SILENT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinned up against the wall, Chris is being embraced and kissed passionately by a MAN whose face is not yet visibl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resisting, Chris pushes him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek... stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEREK is 23, tall, dark and virile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I've been through. Don't ever scare me like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I just wanted to surprise you.  What can I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) You can say... "Hello, how are you?"... for starters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely) Hello.  How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls her towards him to kiss her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving away) You haven't changed a bit.  Always so sure of yourself.  Even when we were kids, when you wanted something, nothing could stop you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're irresistible.  I lose control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just slow down.  Let me get to know you again.  Let me get to know this place again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  There's a whole weekend ahead of us.  There's time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris embraces Derek.  Behind them, passing the porch windows, OUT OF FOCUS, is the shadowy figure of JASON. Neither Chris nor Derek is aware of the presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breaking the embrace) Come outside and help me with the bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The turn and head for the front door.  Jason's figure mov away from the windows, out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Derek bound down the porch steps to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the bags off the top. You get the ones inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris moves around to the opposite side.  The sliding doo which was previously wide open is now closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure, talking out loud) This door was open just a minute ago, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the other side of the van) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the others thrashing about in the lake can b heard as Chris reaches for the handle and whisks the door aside.  Instinctively, she braces herself, but nothing ju out at her.  Annoyed with herself for being so suspicious jumpy, Chris just leans in and grabs for the first bag sh sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HAND springs INTO FRAME and wraps around Chris' wrist. gasps and jumps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly sticks his head out the side of the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my bag.  I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing in there?  Why aren't you down at the lake with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cause they're skinny-dipping and I'm not skinny enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks toward the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, Debbie and Vera frolic about naked in the water.  C and Chuck dive off the dock, fully clothed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black save for a slice of sunlight from an elevated basement window.  The door swings open.  Silhouetted in t doorway are Chili and Chuck just come from the lake, dren and dripping in their wet clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy) It's dark down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way it is, man. Cellars are dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Hell is hot, but I ain't goin' down there either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili flicks a wall switch next to her.  A naked light bu springs to life, glowing dimly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothin' to be afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Chuck by the hand and leads him down the stairs Their sneakers, sodden with water, squeak and squish as t go.  Water drips from their hair and clothes, forming lit puddles that follow their every step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basement is overrun with cobwebs and spiderwebs.  Rus gardening tools, broken bicycle parts and boxes of old to are strewn helter-skelter.  An old washer and dryer sit j to the left of the electrical fusebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Gimme your threads, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck pulls off his shirt and hands it to Chili.  She rin it out onto the floor creating a pool of water under the fusebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Chuck zips down his pants, Chili turns on the dryer. Annoyingly, the dryer RATTLES and SHAKES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the light bulb goes off, plunging the twosome in near darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOREBODING MUSIC enters the SOUNDTRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You broke the electricity, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But yet, the dryer CLATTERS on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From over by the stairs, the SOUND of a METAL OBJECT bein kicked against the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili and Chuck whirl around to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rusty old roller skate bounces down the stairs and hits bottom with a CLUNK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on edge) Who's there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laden with his and Debbie's baggage, Andy enters the fron door, trudges to the base of the spiral staircase and loo up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever happened to equal rights for men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Debbie, unburdened by luggage, reach the second floor landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Andy) Stop bitching.  You can't expect me to carry heavy things in my condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy grumbles and starts up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris throws open the door and allows Debbie to enter fir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was my bedroom.  It's yours for the weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks over to the windows and separates the curtain flooding the room with light.  She opens the windows -- a cool breeze blows in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie surveys the cheerful room with antique furniture t includes a folding.  Japanese-style dressing curtain.  Bu there is one important element missing in this bedroom... there's no bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, Chris... I don't mean to be picky, but... where do we sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an impish smile, Chris goes over to the closet and p out a crumpled mass of netting.  She hands it to Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed) What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hammock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever made love in a hammock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris exits, closing the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (envisioning the pleasant possibilities) Hmmm... why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie begins to unravel the nylon mesh when suddenly, a of wind topples over the Japanese dressing curtain.  It h the floor with a sharp SLAP.  At the same exact moment, t door is kicked open with a BANG, SLAMMING against the opposite wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie jumps.  It's Andy.  He squeezes through the door w the bulky baggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Where's the bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the back of his foot, Andy kicks the door to close i An instant before the door slams shut, we SEE a fleeting ominous, glimpse of Jason behind Andy in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris in CLOSE SHOT, looks around the room, concerned abo what she sees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Derek, come in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: including the whole room.  The bed is a mess as if someon had slept in it recently, the closets are open -- hangers the floor, some linen strewn about, the dresser drawers a pulled out and left hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek comes into the room carrying a box full of wooden paddles with little rubber balls attached by a long elast thread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found.  Remember these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her attention focused elsewhere) Did you stay here last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) No.  I got here just before you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody was in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goldilocks and the Three Bears?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious.  Doesn't this look a little strange to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris begins straightening up the room, pushing in the drawers, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get paranoid.  I'm sure your parents left it this way last time they were here.  You know how messy your father is.  If there was a phone here, I'd call them up right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek moves over to help Chris make the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have an answer for everything, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek shrugs his shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gentle but firm) I just think that it's about time you stopped looking over your shoulder, always expecting there's someone coming after you.  That's no way to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks at Derek thoughtfully, but unconvinced.  They finish making the bed in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several six packs of empty beer bottles line a picnic tab which is further cluttered with half-eaten sandwiches and usual array of picnic goodies. Shelly and Vera sits across from each other, in the midst a beer chugging contest.  Derek, Andy and Chuck sit on ei side Shelly, encouraging him to victory.  Chris, Chili an Debbie, on either side of Vera, do likewise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera downs her next bottle with apparent ease.  Shelly ba as another beer is thrust in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nauseous) No more... I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can.  Come on, Shelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly relents and suffers the beer as it goes down.  The accomplishment is met with a pat on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera, too, hesitates for a moment then chugs her beer, th time more slowly and with a degree of difficulty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tipsy, Shelly rises to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if in control) If you'll all please excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly picks up his small black suitcase and walks off on wobbly legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling after him) How could you let her beat you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: grabs his mouth and runs past the house into the outhouse slamming the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUNDS of Shelly vomiting can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning over the hole, Shelly wipes his mouth with his sleeve.  Weakened and defeated, he sits down and leans hi head back against the wall, closing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OMINOUS TONE enters the SOUNDTRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind Shelly, the CAMERA MOVES past him and LOOKS O from the heart-shaped venthole carved in the door. From this distant vantage point, WE CAN SEE up to a secon floor window where a shadowy figure (Jason) looks down fr behind a sheer curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: opens his eyes and listens to the others by the lake, hav fun without him.  He stands up and OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly comes out of the outhouse.  Alone with his black suitcase, he starts for the front door of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The OMINOUS TONE returns to the SOUNDTRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA CRANES UP to the second-floor bedroom window w moments before the shadowy figure stood watching.  The fi is now gone from the window.  Only the curtains rustle in breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the front door SLAMMING.  Shelly is inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA is behind Shelly as he ascends the spiral staircas Halfway up, he HEARS a LOUD THUD.  Pausing to listen, he turns his face around, right into CAMERA.  He hears nothi further and continues up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he reaches the landing, he HEARS SCREAMING coming fr the lake.  He rushes into the bedroom which faces the wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Andy and Debbie's bedroom where the hammock is now s up, draped with a bedspread.  Shelly looks out on the lak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SCREAMING is nothing more than playful activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the SOUND of a window in the room SLAMMING shut Startled, Shelly whips around to see the window beside th Japanese dressing curtain now closed.  Dust around the wi has been unsettled.  The Japanese curtain wavers.  Shelly cannot see behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He edges over to the curtain and flings it aside.  There' nothing there.  He exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to his room at the far end of the corridor and pushes on the door to open it.  It doesn't budge.  Leadin with his shoulder, he bashes into the door.  This time it gives.  Shelly stumbles off-balance into the room (this i the same room which looks directly down on the outhouse)!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HIGH-PITCHED FOREBODING NOTE enters the SOUNDTRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly takes a long look back down the hallway as he clos the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA HOLDS for a moment on the closed door as the MUSIC NOTE INTENSIFIES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A chilling, bloodcurdling SCREAM, from inside the house, shatters the calm by the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around at the others) Where's Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't seen him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking control) Come on!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads the others in a race towards the house and up th porch steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group barrels into the house and assembles in the liv room at the base of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Shelly!  Where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting up the stairs) Are you all right, Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's spread out and check all the rooms.  Outside, too. (to Chris) You stay with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I can look around by myself. I'll take the upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group disperses.  The CAMERA STAYS with Chris.  She h up the spiral staircase to the second-floor landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks both ways down the corridor and sees Shelly's closed bedroom door at the end of the hall.  She approach tries the knob and pushes.  The door is stuck.  She kicks open with her foot.  The door slams against the wall of t room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (before going in) Shelly...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is in order.  Chris takes a few hesitant steps inside, looking all around.  There's no trace of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two closets in the room.  Chris reaches out for nearest one and pulls open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An axe imbedded in his head, and bleeding profusely, fall forward into Chris' arms.  She SHRIEKS as Shelly's lifele body slides down her arm and slumps to the floor.  Chris recoils, SCREAMING in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: burst into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) He's dead... he's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing Chris and turning her away) Don't look!  Let's just get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Debbie, followed by Chili and Chuck, rush into t room.  They react accordingly, except Andy.  He is curiou unaffected by the gruesome sight.  He bends down over She

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undaunted, Andy places his hand on Shelly's stomach... an tickles him.  Shelly springs to life, giggling uncontroll The others gasp incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, you creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly looks up at the angry mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little worried) I guess I fooled you, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) Why you little bastard!  I'll kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris jumps Shelly and pummels him with punches.  The fak axe falls from his head as Shelly fends off Chris.  Derek grabs her and pulls her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave him alone.  He doesn't know any better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a joke... just a joke... I didn't mean to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting) You never mean to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera glares disdainfully at Shelly.  She finds him pitifu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get out of here.  I'll go get some more booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing her his keys) Here, take my VW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barn doors are wide open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of an ENGINE CHOKING and SPUTTERING to life.  A rusted-out, old Volkswagen Beetle CHUGS out of the barn. Vera is driving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cleaned all of his makeup and blood, Shelly races out of house and runs alongside the VW, peering in at Vera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go with you!  I gotta get away from here, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, Vera zooms off, abandoning Shelly.  But w she reaches the bridge, she brakes and opens the passenge door.  Elated, Shelly bolts to the car and jumps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VW takes off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CASHIER rings up the total as a CO-WORKER bags several packs of beer, bottles of cheap champagne and assorted munchies.  Vera stands at the cash register, searching he pockets for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be $23.50... and we don't accept no food stamps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera sneers at the woman and looks down the aisles for Shelly.  She finds him leafing through a magazine rack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly... I need some money. Throw me your wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly digs into his pocket, comes up with the wallet and tosses it over to Vera. She reaches up to catch it, but it hits the side of her h and drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera bends down to pick it up, but someone beats her to i A black hand with rings on each finger scoops the wallet first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOX... a Black woman outfitted in skin-tight black leathe holds the wallet.  Vera and she have an immediate and mut dislike for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flanking Fox, on either side, is ALI... a strapping Black with a full set of gold teeth... and LOCO... sporting a bandana, gold earrings and leather jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are the three motorcyclists that our group had the in with on the road earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fox and Vera stare at each other, Shelly comes up behi Vera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is... is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Fox) Everything's gonna be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spying Fox with his wallet) Excuse me, but I believe that's mine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and Loco leer at Shelly and surround him.  They lift off the ground, each grabbing an arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Loco) Make a wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frightened) Uh... could I buy you two a beet or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox leafs through the wallet.  Vera holds out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take that, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox continues rummaging through the wallet.  She pulls ou prophylactic packet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading off the foil cover) "A True Trojan... thin as a shadow, strong as a horse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and Loco laugh and drop Shelly to the ground.  He qui regains his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing the packet from Fox) That's mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs for the wallet.  Fox is quick to react, pulling away from Vera's reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't your mama teach you manners? If you want somethin', you ask nice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera's jaw tightens with restraint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vera) Please... be cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fox, teeth clenched) May be please have the wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, "May we please have the wallet... ma'am."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back with difficulty) May we please have the wallet... (pauses) .... ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.  That's real nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses the wallet to Vera.  Ali, Loco, and Fox share good laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera and Shelly pay for the booze, grab their packages an exit the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three cyclists follow after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS with Vera and Shelly as they head for the c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, Ali, Fox and Loco come out of the stor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they following us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back over her shoulder) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gulp!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera and Shelly quickly stuff the back seat of the VW wit their packages.  The fact that three motorcycles are park directly behind their car is not lost on Vera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly is already in the car when Vera jumps into the driver's seat and starts the ignition.  Side by side, Ali Fox and Loco strut deliberately towards the VW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera throws the car into gear and hits the gas pedal.  Th car lurches in reverse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the sound of metal crashing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: has deliberately back up into one of the cycles, starting chain reaction.  The first one collides with a second.  T second collides with a third.  The three motorcycles lie a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking out the back window) Aw, shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enraged, Alice, Fox and Loco race towards the VW and thei injured motorcycles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera quickly shifts gears.  The car CHUGS forward and tak off. CAMERA PANS with the car as it rips past the onrushing ga knocking them aside, and zooms out of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Volkswagen Beetle rattles as it speeds past CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly stretches his neck and looks out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a dirty window. (settles down in his seat) Next time, I'll know how to handle a situation like that.  Let's just hope that "next time" isn't too soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop worrying.  I don't think they'll bother to come after us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLING of motorcycles can be heard in the distance. They both hear it.  Shelly looks at Vera apprehensively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) So, I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly turns to look out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep looking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ROAR of motorcycles grows LOUDER as Vera floors the accelerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing just off the road, Abel, the old doom-sayer that group picked up earlier, has his thumb out for a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the VW flies by him without stopping, Abel looks after with eyes that seem to know something is about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking in her rearview mirror at Abel) Not this time, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of approaching motorcycles grows LOUDER... clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking everywhere) Where the hell are they?  I don't see them anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: looking out the front window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
