dialogues.text: Holy shit!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swooping over a hill, in unison, three motorcycles head straight for them at top speed. It's Ali, Fox and Loco in black helmets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: mouths open, eyes wide with disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera slams on the brakes.  The car skids to a stop.  At t last possible moment, Fox steers her cycle deftly to the right of the VW.  Loco steers left. And, Ali jumps the ca flying over the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ali lands on the highway, the three skid into a U-turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: open their eyes and look behind them.  Shelly braces hims as Vera guns the motor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car takes off.  The motorcycles are in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali easily catches up with the car and pulls up alongside driver's window.  Loco creeps up on the passenger's side. Fox moves in behind the vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: smiles at Vera.  The sun glints off his gold teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: smiles back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whips out a heavy metal chain and smashes it through the windshield, right at CAMERA.  The windshield shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car swerves out of control to the right, knocking int Loco, sending him and his cycle flying off the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vera regains control of the VW, Ali drops back next to behind the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali hands Fox the chain and signals for her to move up th passenger side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly watches as Fox moves up alongside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any good ideas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into the back seat and pulls out a bottle of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no time to celebrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your eyes on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waving the chain menacingly, Fox pulls up alongside Shell window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, Shelly unravels the seal and shakes up the champ bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time to explain.  Just listen. When I yell "stop," you jam on the brakes as hard as you can.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pleased with Shelly's initiative) You're the boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hauls back with the chain and rams it through Shelly's window, barely missing her mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shakes the bottle as he pries up the plastic cork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: rears back with the chain and readies herself to strike a second time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly aims the champagne bottle out the window.  With a final flick of his thumb the cork flies out and strikes F in the face -- a direct hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox reaches for her face and falls backwards off her cycl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullseye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Stop the car!  Now!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera jams on the brakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car comes to a screeching halt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shocked!  Unable to stop in time or swerve out of the way his cycle runs right up the back of the car and flips ove top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VW shifts into first gear and proceeds unimpeded.  Le in its wake are three motorcyclists sprawled out on the highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been on helluva beginning to a quiet weekend in the country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at it this way... things can only get better... Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun casts an orange glow over the landscape as it slo sinks in the West.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy is at one end of the porch working out -- strenuous calisthenics.  Chili and Chuck sit together on the porch swing, opposite Andy, sharing a joint.  They watch Andy's inspiring performance as they rock back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should do some exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all the exercise I need...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises the joint to her mouth and tokes on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, Debbie comes jogging out of the woods, over to the small bridge and towards the house.  Behind h the war-torn Volkswagen Beetle winds its way down the dir road.  Debbie turns and jogs backwards as the car approac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili, Chuck and Andy see the car coming. The damage is evident even from a distance.  They run from the porch as VW passes Debbie and comes to a halt just in front of the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili, Chuck, Andy and Debbie surround the car.  Chuck pu his hand through the frame of the windshield and touches Vera's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your windshield, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you guys?  Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question is... is the beer all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly and Vera grab the bags and get out of the car.  Th hand the packages to Chili and Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a slight misunderstanding with that motorcycle gang... (she puts her arm around Shelly) ... but Shelly made them see the error of their ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heroically) It was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Together, Shelly and Vera head for the house.  Andy and Debbie linger by the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the musty darkness, a HULKING HAND reaches out an stealthily pushes open the creaky barn door.  It's Jason. peeks through the crack and watches the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: come running out of the house.  Derek is dumbfounded at t sight of his abused and battered car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My beautiful car!  What'd you do to it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera and Shelly pass him on their way to the porch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hanging Derek the keys) We're really sorry, but it wasn't our fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few minor repairs and it'll be as good as new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek runs up to his car.  Chris follows.  Shelly and Ver inside the house.  Chili and Chuck follow behind, carryin the packages in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The barn door slowly closes, unseen by anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: examines the injuries sustained by his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too painful to look at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we drive over to the cove and watch the sunset.  It'll mellow you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek considers it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be nice to get away from these crazy friends of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They jump into the car.  The CAMERA PANS with the VW as i drives off, revealing Andy and Debbie leaning against a t kissing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go take a swim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seductively) We'd be all alone.  We could do anything we wanted and nobody would see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds disgusting.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs Debbie by the hand and runs with her towards the lake.  As they run past the van, Debbie breaks away from

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go ahead.  I'm gonna get a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy continues to the lake, walking on his hands when he reaches the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie slides open the side door and crawls inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMINOUS MUSIC invades the SOUNDTRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of DARK BOOTED FEET approach furtively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie's rear end is practically sticking out as the boot sneak around the back of the van and edge their way towar her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Debbie backs down out of the vehicle, blanket i hand, and scampers away without seeing the prowler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TILTS UP from the boots to reveal... Ali, the Blac motorcyclist.  He's carrying an empty gas can and a sipho His eyes scan the area.  There's no one on sight -- Debbi already down by the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He signals with his hands and out from the bushes come Lo and Fox.  They scurry over to the van and duck down next Ali who is unscrewing the van's gas cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't do this, Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta even the score, don't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fox) Nobody's gonna get hurt, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali sticks the siphon down into the fuel tank and lays th gas can on the ground below it.  Loco tries to grab the siphon from Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over anxious) Let me do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (authoritative) I know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox's attention is drawn to the barn as her cohorts conti with the task at hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox cautiously pulls open one of the two doors.  It CREAK loudly.  She stops and looks around to see if anyone has heard -- the coast is clear.  She slips into the barn and pulls the door closed behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spears of fading sunlight, thick with dust, cut across th musty interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox scans the premises.  Her face lights up with the smil a child in a toy store trying to decide which area to exp first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your typical barn with a variety of heavy duty to some rusting; saw horses; wooden benches and ladders; a h stall; haybins, haystacks and a second floor hayloft; and several storage rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the fascination of a street kid who has probably nev seen the inside of a barn, Fox wanders through the rustic interior.  In her high-heeled boots, she has trouble maneuvering around on the muddy, hay covered floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she approaches the toolshed, one of her heels sticks d into a sticky patch of mud and she falls forward off-bala To stop her fall, Fox reaches out for the toolshed handle She grabs it but the rotting old door tears off its hinge and she topples to the ground -- her face landing inches from a pitchfork's prongs aiming upwards at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes focus on the sharp teeth of the pitchfork.  Alar by the close call, Fox tosses the implement away, gets up dusts herself off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking skyward to the loft area, Fox moves over to its ladder and starts up.  The ladder quivers as she ascends, apparently dislodging a bale of hay at the top and sendin crashing towards her.  (Or, was it Jason?)  Fox swings he body out of the way just in time.  The bale whizzes by he and hits the barn floor with a THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues up the ladder and disappears through the lo flooring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and Loco have just completed filling up one gas can a are starting to fill the second one.  Ali sticks the siph in his mouth and draws on it.  The gas begins to flow as shoves the container into place to catch all the fluid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of Fox wailing like a wounded animal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali and Loco spin around and look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fox comes swinging out, Tarzan-like, from the hayloft on rope attached to the block and tackle.  She's having a he of a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Whoaaa....!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watch her incredulously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting in a loud whisper) Quiet, woman!  Get off that thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: disappears from view through the square opening in the lo A second later, she reappears, swinging out on the rope a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it feels so goooooood...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swings back and disappears from view once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is not pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're getting me pissed-off, Fox. We got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time the rope swings out from the loft... without Fo attached.  There's a dead silence.  The rope dangles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Loco) Go get her out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loco hunches over, keeping his body low to the ground as high-tails it to the barn and zips inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loco advances deeper into the barn, his eyes looking everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting darker, minute by minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agitated) Fox... where are ya!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Stop foolin' around.  You're screwin' up everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears the SOUND of banging against the wall of the lof above him.  He starts up the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You've had it now, woman!  I'm mad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loco comes through the opening and steps onto the floorbo The deep shadows hide the corners of the loft and Loco ha squint his eyes to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right behind him, he hears the SOUND of the banging again whips around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of him, Fox's body, raised off the ground and impaled with a pitchfork through her and into the wall. Her eyes are open wide with a deathly stare while her fee kick against the wall with final spasms of life.  Blood f from the penetrations in her torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horrific sight is even too much for Loco.  He gags an grasps his mouth with his hand, choking back a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another MUSICAL STINGER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loco's face registers shock and horror as he runs smack i the teeth of an onrushing pitchfork being thrust at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cringes and gurgles up blood as the prongs are jammed through his stomach and out his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He staggers, the pitchfork handle sticking straight out o his gut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying the two jugs of gasoline, one in each hand, Ali just outside the barn doors.  To gain entrance, he kicks the doors and looks around to see if anyone has heard him He waits for one of the two to let him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Debbie frolic by the waterfall, oblivious to the murderous goings-on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: still waiting to be let in.  He kicks on the door again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud whisper) Loco... Fox... Open this damn door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated by the lack of response from inside, Ali puts can down and pries open the door for himself.  He fumbles way inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali closes the door behind him and immediately hears FOOTSTEPS CLOMPING around above him in the hayloft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you two doin' up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rages over to the ladder and looks up.  His eyes widen mouth drops open.  Directly above him, Loco, the pitchfor still protruding from his stomach, falls through the open in the loft floor, right at Ali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two crash to the barn floor, together.  Ali throws Lo body off of him and struggles to his feet.  He backs away fixated on Loco's engorged corpse and cries out for Fox - deep, moanful bellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA DOLLIES quickly into a CLOSE SHOT on his face. His eyes focus directly in front of him as he SCREAMS rig into CAMERA.  It's Jason!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling) Noooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali turns and makes a mad dash for the door.  In his pani he trips over one of the gas cans.  Frantically, he crawl his hands and knees to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches to pull himself up by the door and a large mon wrench comes smashing down on the side of his face, bashi in his skill.  He slumps to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, Andy and Debbie's voices can be heard approaching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind Jason, the CAMERA MOVES with him to a side wi and peers out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window, we SEE Andy and Debbie, wrapped in th blanket, coming up from the lake.  They're wet and drippi Andy pulls Debbie along with him, towards the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't looked in the barn, yet.  Let's take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Not now.  I'm cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy moves right up to the grimy window.  Shading his eye he peeks inside.  He seems to be looking right at Jason ( CAMERA), but he apparently doesn't see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Debbie) How about a roll in the hay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can play with yourself, 'cause I'm going in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back towards the house.  Andy lingers for a mom then catches up with Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door swings open, Debbie and Andy take one step in... and duck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of little, red rubberballs spring straight at th (and CAMERA), retract quickly and pulsate at them again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's SHELLY, a paddleball in each hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't stop now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy looks into the living room.  Vera, Chili and Chuck a engaged in the same child's play.  Each wallops a little rubberball in their own inimitable style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (adept) Ninety six... ninety seven... ninety eight... ninety nine... one hundred...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues without faltering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fumbling) One hundred... ninety nine... ninety eight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He misses and tries again.  Chili is hitting the ball as she were serving in a tennis match.  It's a veritable wer ring circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who brought up this bright idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrating on the game) We were looking for something to keep our hands busy.  It was either this or an orgy.  Vera chose this. (resigned) What're ya gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fireplace is raging with a full-bodied, crackling fla Debbie drags Andy over to the box of paddle rackets in fr of the fireplace and hands one to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you and I whacking a couple of balls around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They join the others.  Rubberballs are flying from all directions (at CAMERA).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek's VW is parked just off the road overlooking the co not far from the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek flicks on the car's headlights.  They gleam right i CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is standing at the water's edge, backlit by the headlight beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching) Is that better?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods and sits on the shore, looking out at water. rubs the chill from her body.  Derek takes off his jean jacket and puts it around Chris' shoulders.  He sits down beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek tosses pebbles across the shimmering water.  Moonli glints like little stars off the ripples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After an uncomfortable silence, Derek looks over at Chris Silhouetted by the light, Chris' profile is accentuated i all its vulnerability and sensuality. He puts his arm around her.  She tenses up.  Derek wants kiss her, but doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'm not sure I could live anywhere else.  The nights are always so peaceful and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's deceiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The quiet can fool you.  It fooled me.  You can never be sure of what's out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Derek stands up and moves to the edge of the water, picking up handfuls of pebbles and throwing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without looking at Chris) Why did you come back here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitating) ... To prove something to myself... to prove I'm stronger than I think I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, what about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here with you.  Can't that be enough for now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I don't see you for months on end, and when I do, you put this wall between us.  How do I break through?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.  I'm really trying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek sits down next to her, again.  There's momentary silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised you'd never ask me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you left me that night, I didn't see you or talk to you again for a year.  No one would tell me anything.  All I know is what the police told me. (leaning in to her) We have nowhere to go unless you let me in. (pausing) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks into Derek's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of a rubberball hitting the paddle racket with constant, even rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN CLOSE-up, the CAMERA PANS the staring bored faces of Chili, Chuck, Vera, Shelly and Debbie until it stop of th intense, concentrating face of Andy -- the elastic and rubberball pass his face again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... One thousand twelve... one thousand thirteen... one thousand fourteen... What's the World's Record for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the Guinness Book, you passed the World's Record several whacks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely excited) I did?!  I broke the world's record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares, man?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops whacking the ball.  The others sigh with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You're all just jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I have no idea what the World's Record is.  I was just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you're funny?  Well, I'll just have to start all over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole group jumps Andy and wrestles the paddle away f him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Andy by the hand) Come on, Champ, I think you and I can find something to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, dutifully and happily, follows Debbie up the windin staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) Remember that strange looking plant we saw outside.  Let's go smoke it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck follows Chili out the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly looks around.  Vera is the only other person in th room.  They stare at each other, then look away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that leaves you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence.  Shelly gets a very determined look on h face like his is going to ask Vera something he has never asked a woman before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sincere) Vera... you and I have had a chance to really get to know one another today.  I like you... very much.  I was thinking that maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly interrupting) Don't say any more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly drops his head, dejected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I'm going outside for a few minutes.  We'll talk when I get back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away and goes out the front door.  Shelly moves over to the living room window and watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera ambles down the porch steps and when she reaches the front walk, she surveys the surroundings and breathes dee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watches Vera stroll away.  His disappointment is sketched over his face.  He turns away from the window and moves o to the fireplace, looking into the flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's dark, hulking frame moves into THE SHOT as he loo through the window at Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly pokes aimlessly at the hot ambers, his back to the window, unaware of the lurking Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy and Debbie are locked in each other's arms in front the hammock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) First we take off our clothes, then you get on top of me or I get on top of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how to do it.  I mean, how do we do it in the hammock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, Debbie removes her top garment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you can figure it out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at her breasts) I'll think of something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wraps his arms around Debbie and fervently kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sitting on shore, close together, somber.  The headlight beams have dimmed.  The dark, desolate landscape looms ar them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had never made love to anybody before that night. You made it so special, I hope it would always be like that for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA begins to dolly slowly -- ever so slowly -- ar Derek and Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: **OPTIONAL:  The following dialogue may be used as a narr over a FLASHBACK SEQUENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you dropped me off at the house, it was very late.  My parents were waiting up for me. As soon as I got in the door, they starting yelling and cursing at me.  I was so upset... I told them I slept with you.  My mothers slapped me.  That was the first time she'd ever hit me.  I couldn't believe it.  I ran out of the house and into the woods as fast and as far as I could run. I was crying.  They had destroyed the most beautiful night of my life and I wanted to punish them for that.  I decided to hide out all night.  They'd be so worried  that they'd be sorry for what they did to me.  The woods were cold and damp from the rain.  I found a dry spot under a rotted oak tree and I guess I fell asleep. (takes a deep breath) All I can remember next is being startled out of sleep by the sound of footsteps.  I thought it was my father so I hid behind the tree. But the footsteps just stopped. The woods were dark.  I couldn't see anything. (intensifying) I heard a cracking noise behind me.  I turned around and... and... oh, God... there was this hideous looking man.  So grotesque he was almost inhuman.  He had a knife and he started to slash away at me, again and again.  I was so hysterical and I don't know how I was able to get away.  I ran and ran, but he kept coming.  He was big but so fast.  He caught me and pulled me down to the ground and he... he... ripped my blouse off. I was screaming, but who could hear me?  Then... oh, God... he dragged me by the hair along the ground.  I was kicking and yelling.  He dragged me deeper and deeper into the woods.  Oh, please... please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stroking her) It's all right, you're all right. I'm with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: *OPTIONAL:  End FLASHBACK SEQUENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't know what happened after that.  I must have fainted because the next thing I knew I would talk about it.  And I never have.  Not until now.  I just wanted to forget.  But I can't. I'll never forget that horrible face.  Never.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car headlights suddenly snap off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around.  There's no one in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the battery, damnit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two run up to the car.  Derek jumps in and tries to s it.  The engine WHIRS but won't turn over.  Chris looks apprehensively at Derek.  He grabs a flashlight from the glove compartment, flicks it on and gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking Chris' hand) It's no problem.  We'll just walk back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand-in-hand, the two start down the wooded path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SHOOTS over the waterfall towards the dock.  Vera strolls down the wooded platform -- the old boards CREAK beneath her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the flowing water can be heard as a darkened, indistinguishable FIGURE ENTERS FRAME -- directly in fron CAMERA -- and lowers himself all the way into the lake by waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera rolls her pant legs up to her knees.  She dangles he long legs over the dock.  Her toes break the surface of t water, SWOOSHING it back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Air bubbles rise to the top.  Vera does not see the darke figure as he swims beneath the surface of the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night is a symphony of sounds:  crickets SCRATCHING e masse, branches and leaves FLUTTERING in the evening bree water LAPPING at the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Vera.  She leans back, her arms bent behind her, her f arched upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: kick back and forth SPLASHING the water.  Air bubbles mar the trail of the approaching underwater figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera breathes in.  The sensuous serenity deeply relaxes h She begins to softly sing a song form her childhood in Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera's feet are an arms length away, kicking towards the CAMERA LENS.  She finishes her song and lays back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure jumps out of the water and grabs Vera's leg an pulls her.  Vera SCREAMS and lurches forward, almost slid off the dock.  She reaches out and clings to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The figure holds her calves and tugs harder.  Vera's gras slipping.  She tries to kick him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the figure releases her limbs and submerges underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera pulls herself back up onto the dock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clad in a black scuba suit and white faceless mask, the rotund figure rises out of the water onto the shore.  In hand he holds a small spear-gun.  With the other, he remo his mask.  It's Shelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've just learned a valuable lesson.  A beautiful girl like you should never go out in the dark alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn you, Shelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera stomps off the dock towards him.  Shelly retracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Why do you do these stupid things?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away) I have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't "have to."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do like you.  But not when you act like a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being a jerk is better than being nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said you were "nothing".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't to say it.  I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly hangs his head and says nothing further.  He just walks off towards the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic) Hey... I'll be in, in a little while.  We can talk some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly trudges up the front walk to the porch and plops himself down on the porch swing, still clutching the mask spear-gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a contemplative mood, he slowly swings back and forth. The taut metal chains that support the swing, vibrate and CREAK in a steady rhythm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly looks down at the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera sits back down on the dock, facing away from the hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: is alerted to what sounds like the cry of a wounded anima emanating from the barn.  He looks over and sees a shadow cross in front of one of the windows.  The cry continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly jumps off the swing and heads for the barn with hi mask and spear-gun at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly comes up to the window and looks in.  It's too dar see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rapping on the window) Chuck?  Chili?  What're you guys doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears RUMBLING inside, but no response.  He moves to t front doors and pries them open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly comes in and fumbles for the light switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys doin' somethin' I shouldn't see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finds the switch and FLICKS on the light.  The very mo the light goes on, an OWL swoops down and aims straight f his head (and CAMERA).  Shelly drops the spear-gun and th mask to thwart off the bird with his hands.  The owl flie out of the partially open barn doors.  Shelly quickly clo them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera is pacing, back and forth, on the dock.  She stops a the far edge and peers into the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating by is a woman's bra (probably, Debbie's).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera smirks as she lies prone on the boards and reaches w her hand, grabbing the undergarment and rescuing it from lake. She leans back into a kneeling position and rings out the soggy bra.  Her heels dig into the rear pocket of her jea pushing a wallet out of the pocket onto the dock.  Vera reaches behind her and picks it up.  It's Shelly's wallet the one he gave her at the liquor store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leafing through the contents, Vera finds his driver's lic and a photograph of Shelly and his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around.  Shelly is nowhere in sight.  Assuming has returned to the house, she gets up to look for him -- she rises, her hand knocks against the dock.  The wallet slips out her her grasp and bounces into the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching the wallet sink) That's just great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment of deliberation, she takes off her shoe an plunges into the water, diving after the billfold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She swims around underneath the surface, searching with h hands.  She rises for air periodically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She submerges deeper than the previous attempts.  Air bub rising to the surface, establish her whereabouts -- a goo distance from the shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes up for air once more, empty-handed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the dock.  A dark figure, wearing Shelly's white mask and holding the spear-gun, kneels at the edge of the pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the water, at this distance, Vera easily mistakes th figure (Jason) for Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving to the figure, shouting) Hey... I dropped your wallet!  I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to breast stroke toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMINOUS MUSIC throbs on the SOUNDTRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason raises the spear-gun to eye level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera swims unknowingly toward her demise.  A few yards fr the dock, she glides right into Shelly's floating wallet. Jason aims the spear-gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera, grabbing the wallet, she treads water and raises it triumphantly over her head for "Shelly" to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I found it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up to see the spear-gun pointed right at her he (and CAMERA).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panicked) What're you doing?  Who are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason pulls the trigger, releasing the spear.  With a WHO the arrow penetrates Vera's skull.  A look of unmitigated disbelief on Vera's face as she sinks into the water.  Bl seeps to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of lake and dock.  Jason, in the distance, his back to CAMERA, just stands at the edge of the pier looking down the bloody water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS over to the house and CRANES UP to a second f bedroom window, glowing from candlelight, and peers in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is darkened save for pools of light emanating fr several candles -- one in each window, the others on the opposite side of the room -- lending an atmosphere of war and intimacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DOLLIES IN towards the hammock which wildly rocks and forth accompanied by the sounds of lovemaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie and Andy are not visible in full -- only glimpses their naked limbs and torsos can be seen above the curved side of the hammock.  Blankets and sheets hang sloppily o the edges to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA continues to DOLLY IN as the SOUNDS grow more heat until Debbie and Andy are FRAMED in a TWO SHOT as they cl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thrashing about stops and the hammock slows down to a gentle swaying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the best yet.  Was it you... me... or the hammock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vote for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vote for the hammock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie attempts to get out of the hammock.  It's not a si move -- she nearly falls to the floor taking Andy with it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm seasick.  Get in or get out of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie gets out.  She heads into the bathroom and flicks the light -- bright and a strain to the eyes.  She turns the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loud) What're you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (poking her head back in) I think it's called "a shower". You might try it sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too clean for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie responds by closing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOREBODING MUSIC pierces the SOUNDTRACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Displaying a thick-bladed machete, Jason ascends the spir stairs.  Andy can be heard off-screen calling loudly to Debbie in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Deb... can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from bathroom) Barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) I'm going downstairs to get a beer. You want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason reaches the landing at the top of the stairs and disappears into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the sheer curtain, Debbie's naked silhouette can b seen lathering herself in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie luxuriates in the soap and hot water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distorted through the plastic curtain, the door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie remains blissfully unaware as she soaps her face. hears a BANGING NOISE.  Her eyes are closed due to the so and shower spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response.  Concerned, Debbie turns off the water and w the soap from her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking up, she sees a shadowy figure poised in front of curtain.  Quickly, she reaches out and rips the curtain aside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staring her in the face is a pair of men's feet and jean- covered legs.  It's Andy, walking on his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (upside-down) Do you want a beer or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy turns himself around and handwalks out of the bathro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be back in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie jumps out of the tub and shuts the door.  She retu to the shower and turns the water back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT on Andy upside-down.  CAMERA MOVES with him as hand-steps out of the bedroom.  He WHISTLES an upbeat tun he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OMINOUS TONE enters the SOUNDTRACK, a haunting counter to Andy's WHISTLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's hulking frame is braced up against the wall in th hallway corridor at the entrance to the bedroom.  Andy is unaware of Jason's presence as he hand-walks right past h boots towards the staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off-screen, Debbie calls out to Andy over the SOUND of th shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy... Are you still out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the head of the stairs, Andy stops and pivots around 1 degrees, turning head-on into Jason's boots.  Surprised, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: of Jason in Shelly's white mask.  A machete is poised abo his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Andy can react, the machete is thrust down between legs, slicing through his upside-down body.  Andy's ghast SCREAM reverberates as he topples backwards down the spir stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason retrieves his body.  He drags Andy's halved corpse the stairs and back into the bedroom, closing the door be him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the shower running full blast, the door closed, and HUMMING to herself, Debbie remains oblivious to the sound the murderous activities.  She rinses her hair and turns the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA MOVES slowly IN CLOSE on Debbie as she steps b of the tub and dries herself off. She hears a CRASHING SOUND that seems to have come from t bedroom.  She stands still and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy?  You can have my beer.  I don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Humming again, she wraps herself in her robe and swings t bathroom door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is quiet, untouched.  Andy is nowhere in sight. Debbie shrugs it off, moves to the bedroom door, opens it sticks her head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling downstairs) Andy, don't bring me a beer.  Do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stays at the door for a moment listening for Andy.  B her, in the bedroom, Jason creeps across room.  Debbie is unaware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Andy!  Answer me!  I hate when you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She SLAMS the door shut!  Peeved at Andy, she picks up a (Stephen King's newest novel) from a table and rolls into hammock top of the covers which hang all the way to the f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She settles in.  The hammock sways slightly.  She finds h place in the book and playing with her damp hair, she sta to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite unexpectedly from above her, a large drop of blood falls and splatters all over the white pages of her book. Alarmed, she touches the fluid with her finger tips, examining it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous, to herself) Blood...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at the ceiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrapped around the rafters is Andy's mangled, bloodied co Before Debbie can SCREAM...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From beneath the hammock, hidden by the covers, Jason's h reaches up and around and snaps her head back down, pinni her to the pillow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The carving knife is driven through the back of her neck pops out the front, right at CAMERA.  Blood spurts all ov Debbie's horrified face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flashlight beam sprays directly into the CAMERA LENS bleaching out the FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek and Chris silently walk along the dirt road leading back to the house.  Derek holds the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their footsteps add to the cacophony of night sounds.  Ch eyes dart about; she's becoming quite uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we move a little faster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, just watch where you're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to job.  The beam from their flashlight bounce all over the road as they run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly and unwittingly, Derek strides into a pothole, t his ankle and falls forward.  The flashlight falls from h hand.  Derek lands in the arms of a dark figure standing the side of the road.  Derek gasps as the man clutches hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris grabs the flashlight from the ground and shines the light into the man's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Abel, the aged hitchhiker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek gets back on his feet.  The ankle is tender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm one of the Flock as are you my Brother and Sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking askance) Yeah... sure... (to Chris) I think we should be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to leave, but Abel blocks their path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look old man, we don't want any trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then turn around and walk away from trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Chris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derek hobbles past Abel.  Chris follows a moment later. looks after them as they go then up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have done by best.  I can do no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris looks back at Abel as she and Derek continue down t road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck stands at the stove, shaking a pot of popcorn over lit burner.  The corn kernels are actively popping as Chu lifts the cover off the pot, revealing the white fluffy morsels as they fly up and out (at CAMERA).  Chuck leans to catch them with his mouth.  He captures a few though m land on the floor.  He quickly replaces the lid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili comes in from outside with a flashlight in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find the bong anywhere. Can't you remember where you dropped it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't even remember what day it is, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Friday the 13th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights go out -- complete darkness except for the blue fire of the lit burner.  Chili SCREAMS over the soun the popping corn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) What's the matter?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.  I was just foolin' around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do that to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili flicks on the flashlight and hands it to Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Go down the cellar and check the fusebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you come with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be a man, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili takes a kerosene lamp down from the window sill as Chuck reluctantly opens the cellar door and starts down t stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili ignites the lamp's wick, illuminating the kitchen w a yellow glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She carries the lamp over to the stove and sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barefoot, Chuck tiptoes down into the dark, musty basemen The flashlight beam preceeds his every step as he slowly advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To calm his anxieties, he talks to himself, outloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his eyes roving all around) There's nothin' to be scared of, man.  Just go over to the fusebox and check it out.  You can do that.  Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His bare feet SLOSH in the line of the water puddles on t cellar floor as he nears the fusebox.  He raises the flashlight at the open box -- the fuses and electrical wi exposed.  The main switch is in the "OFF" position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck lifts the switch into the "ON" position.  The naked basement bulb glimmers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to go) Whew... that's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Backlit and silhouetted by the bulb is Jason -- a threate sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck is startled and scared.  Before he can speak, Jason grabs his face with both hands, lifts him off the ground throws him into the open fusebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck's feet land in a pool of water as his hands make contact with the exposed electrical wires.  Electricity z through his entire body, electrocuting him.  The lights b on and off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili is standing at the stove shaking a second pot of popcorn kernels.  The blinking lights are an annoyance, causing her to squint.  Then, the blinking stops and the lights go completely dead.  The lantern remains the only light source.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) What's goin' on, Chuck?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no answer.  Then abruptly, something heavy bashes against the kitchen door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What's goin' on around here? Who's there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the lantern and goes to the door.  She hesit then pulls it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly's corpse -- his skull split open, his face and che bloodied -- falls into the kitchen at Chili's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Get up, Shelly.  Stop foolin' around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She believes this to be another of Shelly's ruses.  Stepp over his body, she goes to the basement stairs and calls to Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) What're you doin' down there, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the kerosene lamp in front of her, Chili starts d the stairs.  FOREBODING MUSIC drones on the SOUNDTRACK, accompanying her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  She stops at the bottom of the stairs and pan the lamp from side to side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, as though suspended from the ceiling, Chuck's h and shoulders flop down in front of her, his arms outstre and his face stark white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling) Oh, my God... (shouting) Help!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and runs up the stairs, the kerosene lamp shaki wildly in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bolts out of the basement and stumbles over Shelly's body, falling to the floor.  She looks back at Shelly and realizes that this is not a joke and that he is, indeed,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gags and, SCREAMING, grabs the still lit kerosene lam and scrambles to her feet.  She runs into the living room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fireplace is burning bright as Chili dashes to the ba of the spiral staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up) Andy!  Debbie!  Somebody help me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen by Chili, Jason's hand reaches for a sizzling poke left in the fire and pulls out the red-hot iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chili swings open the front door.  The CAMERA MOVES in on from behind.  Crying, she SCREAMS out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vera!  Chris!  Where is everybody?!!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps out onto the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA continues towards her from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at the edge of the steps) Oh please, is anybody here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks all around.  It's deathly quiet.  She whips aro and runs back into the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: right at Jason and into the scorching poker.  It burns through her blouse and fries the skin around where it penetrates.
